string¶

class isopy.string[source]¶

Create an IsopyString from the input.

There is no asstring counterpart because strings are immutable. This means that a string cannot be modified. Any attempt to modify a string will return a new string.

Parameters

item (str) – String to be parsed

Returns

IsopyString of item. If item already is an IsopyString it is returned.

Return type

MassString, ElementString, IsotopeString or RatioString

Raises

ValueError – Raised if item cannot be parsed into an IsopyStrings.

Examples

>>> isopy.string('pd102')
'102Pd'
>>> type(isopy.string(105))
'MassString'
